title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not explain, in terms of energy flow through trophic levels, why regions with a significant and sustained decrease in tree cover have also been shown to experience local food chain and food web disruptions, such as any of the following:

· Primary producers, which include trees, are the first trophic level and source of usable energy for ecosystems, food chains and food webs. When forests are removed/clear-cut, the amount of available energy/biomass for the next trophic level is substantially reduced. This disrupts all higher trophic levels in the ecosystem/food chain/food web due to population die-off and/or migration.

· Trees provide habitat for many insects, small mammals, birds, and other primary consumers. If these organisms decrease in number from a decrease in available habitat, then consumers in higher trophic levels will have less food and likely decline.
